Where to start…Sasha, it sounds like you understand that uncontrolled diabetes is very risky; along with the rest of your chosen lifestyle; I won’t waste any time lecturing you about the crank. If you live in the U.S., go to the county health department, and see if they can help with any of this.You need to prioritize your needs; stop using, figure out how to manage your blood sugar, and then get tested for HIV, viral hepatitis, etc. If you’re drinking, it can raise your liver enzyme levels; however, this probably takes a back seat to your other problems. Getting some form of control over your current lifestyle sounds like the most important thing you can do at this time.Be kind to yourself; you won’t last long like this—Bill
